title: Add --system-file flag to read system prompt from file
description:
Allow loading system prompts from files for easier management and reuse.

Current workaround:
consoul ask --system "$(cat prompt.txt)" "question"

Proposed:
consoul ask --system-file prompt.txt "question"

Benefits:
- Easier to manage long/complex system prompts
- Reusable prompt templates
- Version control friendly
- No shell escaping issues

Implementation:
1. Add --system-file flag alongside --system
2. Read file content and use as system_prompt_override
3. Validate file exists and is readable
4. Error handling for large files (maybe 10KB limit?)
5. Mutually exclusive with --system flag

Related to: SOUL-207
